data.title: Has Beans is my go to weekend in downtown Chico Stop
data.text: I enjoy going here for the down home feel.  Good coffee and danish.  Service is very lovely and adds to the calming vibes of the place.  I especially enjoy a seat by the windows to watch the weekenders walk about before noon.  The coffee and food is very good.  The serve tea but i don't drink it.  Papers are available to read if you want to just sit and enjoy the vibes, view, and value.

data.title: Coffee
data.text: Convenient by main drag of tge small town. .The plaza is close by,shops are walking distance. .small town atmosphere

data.title: Cute coffee shop
data.text: Nice coffee shop, quieter than those Starbucks and Pete's.  Ordered a hazel nut iced latte, not too shabby! These smaller coffee shops always seem to taste better then the commercial coffee shops.

data.title: A Favorite!
data.text: Yes, they are not open as long as the nearby Starbucks, but for morning and noon fare they are excellent. Lots of parking nearby and a favorite with locals who would rather patronize a long-standing local coffee house.

data.title: Best Coffee in Town!
data.text: Has Beans has great atmosphere. The coffee is fantastic. The staff is nice. They have open mike nights which are a lot of fun. I'm not sure if they still have poetry slams but they were way cool back in the day. Check out the art or get some work done here, it's my favorite spot in Chico.

data.title: There are a lot of coffee houses...this one comes with color and tasty German sweets.
data.text: Located just across from the Downtown Plaza this is a good spot to onserve some of the more colorful life in Chico. Mind you lock your bike well! The coffee is good and there are seasonal German sweets that are great! I believe the owner has some kind of German connection. Lebkukken anyone?

data.title: Cozy coffee place
data.text: This is cozy coffee place with a larger room that can be opened up if there is need. The food is homemade and delicious. My friend who needs to be gluten-free loves their bread and actually buys a loaf each week to use at home because it is so tasty.

data.title: Great coffee spot with wifi and a restroom that they don't care who uses it.
data.text: Great little coffee spot. Great local spot, lock you bike with a u-lock as bike theft is rampant in Chico

data.title: Another great coffee place in the downtown core
data.text: Solid coffees and pastries caddy-corner to the downtown plaza and across street from city hall.  Lots of room, and a particularly inviting place to gather with friends for conversation.  Sells the full range of coffee equipment and whole beans.  Nice outdoor french bistro table seating as well
